citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
There is an accumulation of cobwebs in the corners of the walls and within the window sills of the cat rooms. The
approximate size of the cobwebs are 12 inches X 12 inches in all four corners of the rooms, and approximately 6 inches X
6 inches within the window sills. The presence of cobwebs can collect dust and other debris and may affect the health and
wellbeing of the cats. A system should be in place to ensure cobwebs are removed as needed to facilitate the husbandry
practices required in this subpart. Premises where housing facilities are located, including buildings, and surrounding
grounds must be kept clean, to facilitate the husbandry practices required in this subpart, to protect the health and
wellbeing of the animals.
To be corrected by December 31,2023

In the pigeon primary enclosure: There is a vertical support beam that is not securely anchored to the horizontal support
beams. Following light/moderate manual pressure by the inspector, the beam easily moved and appeared unstable.
Primary enclosures that are not structurally sound may cause an injury to the birds housed within. Primary enclosures
must be designed and constructed of suitable materials so that they are structurally sound and kept in good repair to
prevent injury to the birds.
To be corrected by December 31, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.11(c) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
There is an accumulation of cobwebs in the corners of the walls and within the window sills of the cat rooms. The 
approximate size of the cobwebs are 12 inches X 12 inches in all four corners of the rooms, and approximately 6 inches X 
6 inches within the window sills. The presence of cobwebs can collect dust and other debris and may affect the health and 
wellbeing of the cats. A system should be in place to ensure cobwebs are removed as needed to facilitate the husbandry 
practices required in this subpart. Premises where housing facilities are located, including buildings, and surrounding 
grounds must be kept clean, to facilitate the husbandry practices required in this subpart, to protect the health and 
wellbeing of the animals. 
To be corrected by December 31,2023 
3.153(a)(1)(ii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
In the pigeon primary enclosure: There is a vertical support beam that is not securely anchored to the horizontal support 
beams. Following light/moderate manual pressure by the inspector, the beam easily moved and appeared unstable. 
Primary enclosures that are not structurally sound may cause an injury to the birds housed within. Primary enclosures 
must be designed and constructed of suitable materials so that they are structurally sound and kept in good repair to 
prevent injury to the birds.  
To be corrected by December 31, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
